review_snippet: We ordered oxtail, jerk chicken, and a whole fish. Every plate was flavorful and absolutely delicious.
full_review:
You are immediately greeted by pleasant staff. We ordered oxtail, jerk chicken, and a whole fish. Every plate was flavorful and absolutely delicious. The vanilla rum cake blew us away! I am not a huge cake and sweets person but I inhaled my slice of cake Lol.
I would definitely recommend this restaurant !

review_snippet: I came here just before closing and ordered a medium brown stew chicken and the curry goat. Both were delicious, tasted fresh and well seasoned.
full_review: I came here just before closing and ordered a medium brown stew chicken and the curry goat. Both were delicious, tasted fresh and well seasoned. Will definitely be going back.

review_snippet: Very basic burritos, not much to it, if you order a steak burrito sometimes it comes with enough and other times you get two pieces if that.
full_review:
Okay, this place is never consistent! The only time I liked my food was the first time I ordered it. The second time I ordered a burrito online I got a rice and bean burrito, once I opened I saw it was only rice and beans‚Ä¶. I went back in to complain and the cashier tried to tell me I was wrong until I showed her my online order. I gave them another chance recently and got another rice and bean burrito! The burrito was all rice!!!!! Probably 2 pieces of beans in there. if I wanted just a rice burrito that‚Äôs what I would order but I didn‚Äôt. They just have 0 consistency, they either nail your order or they completely mess it up.

Online ordering should have way more options than it does. Very basic burritos, not much to it, if you order a steak burrito sometimes it comes with enough and other times you get two pieces if that.

review_snippet: We had the El Fish and Pollo Asado tacos, WOW they were so yummy and fresh!! Will definitely be back!
full_review: My husband and I stopped for a quick bite and the service, especially bar tender, Abso, was incredible attentive, nice and makes great margaritas and fresh lemonade! We had the El Fish and Pollo Asado tacos, WOW they were so yummy and fresh!! Will definitely be back!

review_snippet: 2-My frozen margarita was more like a sloshy attempt at being frozen. 3-Now, the salsa is where it really counts for me since, I was born and raised in California.
full_review:
I think people like this place because it‚Äôs mostly all outdoors, including the bar, which gave it a cool atmosphere. The staff was nice but, the food was not so nice.

My boyfriend ordered for us while I was in the restroom (which the toilet seat was barely holding on) and when our food came, I noticed green thick sauce on my taco. The menu said tomatillo sauce, but that didn‚Äôt look like tomatillo. We asked the server if it has avocado in it and he said yes. I‚Äôm unfortunately allergic to avocado and right then told the waiter I was. Since my bf didn‚Äôt tell them of my allergy when ordering (he didn‚Äôt because nothing said guacamole or avocado in the description) I just told the waiter it was fine and gave my bf the tacos. Let me say though, I don‚Äôt understand the deal with putting avocado in everything like, verde or tomatillo salsa?!

Moving on: this is long, bear with me.
1- The corn tortilla wasn‚Äôt homemade, that‚Äôs fine- it‚Äôs an island, but it was chewy from being over greased and heated on the grill.
2-My frozen margarita was more like a sloshy attempt at being frozen.
3-Now, the salsa is where it really counts for me since, I was born and raised in California. It was absolutely not salsa at all. It was essentially red enchilada sauce, red pepper flakes, and cilantro. What‚Äôs a girl gotta do to get some sort of tomato around here? üëÄüëÄ I mean, I still ate some because, everything is expensive on MV and I had to give my taco away. So, skip the salsa, you‚Äôd be better off having their ‚Äúgringo salsa‚Äù or pico de gallo.
author: laurin mitchell

author: Debbie J

review_snippet: But I'm not, because, honestly, the pizza is ridiculously good. So good, that frankly, it's worth the wait.
full_review:
I walked out pretty upset, actually (but...stay tuned). We ordered for a pre-sunset pick-up on our way to South Beach. We received notification that it was ready at 5:28 -- perfect! Walked in. Actually not ready. Due to an unexplained "mistake" in the kitchen, we had to wait 30 minutes, and with six little children sitting in the car, and sunset at 6:10, this wasn't ideal. It would have been a nice touch to offer something to make up for it, but other than "it'll be a few more minutes," nobody said anything. Sitting in an empty restaurant watching the clock is no fun.

So did I expect to be posting a 1-star review? Yeah. But I'm not, because, honestly, the pizza is ridiculously good. So good, that frankly, it's worth the wait. We got a GF pepperoni (heads up, that comes in small -- the Instacart menu didn't indicate, so we thought it was going to be bigger) and Talia's Choice (artichoke, garlic, mushroom, pesto). Quite possibly the best pizza I've ever had, and I would try it again.
author: Olivia Braaten

review_snippet: They have pizzas, sandwiches for breakfast, teriyaki, chicken fingers, mozzarela sticks, and bunch of different food.
full_review:
I have ordered X large pizza for out, for my friends, the staff was very convient to handle, they give you all needed information and preferences. I realy liked the perfect how it was said time for waiting, 20 minutes usually  for pizza. I didnt eat, but friends were delighted.
They have pizzas, sandwiches for breakfast, teriyaki, chicken fingers, mozzarela sticks, and bunch of different food. It isnt very healthy meals option restaurant but it is very good pizzeria and fast, quick, big portions food.

The best breakfast place on the island - no questions asked.  Visited this little gem a couple of times this year and I cannot wait to go back.

I had the spicy pulled pork hash which was seasoned and cooked to perfection.   My wife opted for the avacado toast with sunnies which she shared with me.  The kids loved their pancakes, and we also shared the bluberry SCONES which were a special of the day and they were, as you guess it, out of this world.

Great Little Gem that I wish I could take home with me.

Thanks G!

full_review: A wide variety of  Asian cuisine for the menu and is open year round on the island! Great customer service! Great ambiance and vibes at the restaurant. author: C

review_snippet: As for the main course, I chose the Kung Pao chicken, and it didn't disappoint! The dish was expertly prepared, with the perfect balance of spicy and savory flavors.
full_review:
I recently dined at Mikado, and the experience was nothing short of exceptional! From the moment I walked in, the atmosphere was warm and inviting, setting the perfect tone for a delightful meal. The restaurant exudes cleanliness and attention to detail, creating a comfortable environment for diners.

The service at Mikado was truly outstanding. The staff was attentive, courteous, and entertained conversation, I sat in the bar area, which made the dining experience even more enjoyable. They were prompt in taking orders and ensured that everything was to my satisfaction.

One of the highlights for me was the soothing background music that enhanced the overall ambiance. It created a relaxing atmosphere, allowing me to savor my meal in a peaceful setting.

I opted for the floral green tea, and I must say, the flavor is delightful! The tea had a subtle, yet distinct, floral note that complemented the meal perfectly.

As for the main course, I chose the Kung Pao chicken, and it didn't disappoint! The dish was expertly prepared, with the perfect balance of spicy and savory flavors. The chicken was tender, and the accompanying vegetables were fresh and crisp, showcasing the chef's skill and attention to quality ingredients.

Overall, my visit to Mikado was a memorable one, thanks to its excellent service from Cindy, pristine environment, inviting ambiance, and delicious offerings. I would highly recommend this restaurant to future visitors seeking a top-notch dining experience.
author: Juliet Marie

review_snippet: We came back twice ‚Ä¶ ceviche unbelievable taste and value, fig and prosciutto pizza, apple crisp - super yummy.
full_review: Absolutely amazing food!  We came back twice ‚Ä¶ ceviche unbelievable taste and value, fig and prosciutto pizza, apple crisp - super yummy.  Brown sugar steak tips and braised lamb shank the next time - so wonderful we couldn‚Äôt order a pizza to take home as planned.  Great place with lots of locals and bartenders that can make drinks not on the menu!
author: Margaret Caroccia

review_snippet: Personally, I've had the scallops, Bang Bang Cauliflower, SW Chicken Egg Rolls, and the Fried Fishermans Platter - which can serve two. All are good.
full_review:
Who knew a bowling alley could have such great food?

We were skeptical when we were told how good the food is at Barn Bowl & Bistro, but having been there about a dozen times now, we're convinced. They serve up great dishes with consistency and at a reasonable price for the Island.

Most recently I had their Brazilian churrasco bbq...where they come to your table with skewers of meat and slice off what you want. At $34.99, it's an awesome deal for some delicious meats. It comes with three sides: rice, a salsa of sorts, and a third dish which I didn't catch the name of but was quite tasty. Currently, they're talking about offering it on Saturdays - maybe Fridays - so call first. And go support them so they continue to serve it up!

Other suggestions...the shrimp and sausage pasta is great as are the pizzas. I haven't had the curry but friends have and thoroughly enjoyed it. Personally, I've had the scallops, Bang Bang Cauliflower, SW Chicken Egg Rolls, and the Fried Fishermans Platter - which can serve two. All are good. A lot of folks tout the fried chicken but the night my husband had it, it wasn't well seasoned. And rumor has it there might be better fish and chips elsewhere.

The restaurant is clean and comfortable. The staff is awesome and they mix great drinks. All in all, it's an establishment we'll continue to enjoy and support.

Oh, and the bowling is great too!
author: Garrick

review_snippet: The lobster bisque is fantastic. A sandwich, lobster bisque, and the gorgeous sunsets is all anyone really needs.
full_review:
Travellers, the net result is a seafood take-out restaurant with a fish store inside. Or the fish store also serves take out food. Which ever is the case give this a try. The flounder sandwich is wonderful. The fish is fresh and perfectly fried lightly and then stuffed into the bun. All the fried foods are fresh and delicious. The seafood is amazing too. The real stars are the ready to go soups and items that are made in house and stock the shelves. The lobster bisque is fantastic. A sandwich, lobster bisque, and the gorgeous sunsets is all anyone really needs. Check it out. We recommend.

TLDR excellent fried and fresh seafood

review_snippet: There‚Äôs everything you‚Äôd expect to find at a general store, along with a counter-service kitchen where you can get a great lobster roll, a smoothie, and more.
full_review: An excellent spot to grab snacks for the beach, a souvenir to take home, or even a meal after a day spent exploring the Island. It‚Äôs near South Beach, and I was thankful to stumble upon it after riding my bike from West Tisbury, enjoying the beach, and then heading up your way Edgartown. There‚Äôs everything you‚Äôd expect to find at a general store, along with a counter-service kitchen where you can get a great lobster roll, a smoothie, and more. While it is expensive, it‚Äôs not out of line compared with other spots on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. They have a nice little outdoor dining area to enjoy if you don‚Äôt want to take it to go. While I didn‚Äôt get a souvenir, the T-shirts they sell taught me how to properly pronounce Katama, the cherry on top for me!

author: Nicole C.

review_snippet: We ordered the Loaded Nachos, Chicken Bacon ranch Quesadillas, and Wings, and everything was delicious and satisfying. The nachos were just as she remembered: crispy, cheesy, and loaded.
full_review:
We had such an amazing experience at Sharky‚Äôs! My pregnant sister came all the way from the Netherlands to visit me here on the Vineyard, and all she could talk about was the nachos from Sharky‚Äôs. She hadn‚Äôt had them in over 7 years, but they were her absolute favorite back then, and this visit definitely did not disappoint.

We ordered the Loaded Nachos, Chicken Bacon ranch Quesadillas, and Wings, and everything was delicious and satisfying. The nachos were just as she remembered: crispy, cheesy, and loaded. The quesadillas were packed with flavor and grilled perfectly, and the wings were hot, crispy, and juicy.

The food came out quickly, the staff was super friendly, and the whole atmosphere was fun and casual, perfect for a memorable meal with family. Sharky‚Äôs truly made our reunion special. Highly recommend!
author: Alesha Moraes Ramos

review_snippet: Ordered boneless wings last night and they were so over cooked and dry. The picture does no justice in how dark and over fried the meat was.
full_review:

The staff is always bunched up at the computer talking to each other and no one even greets you as you walk through the door. You just have to awkwardly break up their conversation to ask for your food. Every time.

review_snippet: Had a Chimichanga it was flavored well, but the rice a little bland. Just did takeout so can't say much about atmosphere.
full_review: Food was good. Had a Chimichanga it was flavored well, but the rice a little bland. Just did takeout so can't say much about atmosphere. It just seemed comfortable.  The service was prompt and pleasant.   Oh and the loaded cheese tater tots is awesome.

review_snippet: The fact that they have perfected the art of getting the pancakes to your table while they are piping hot deserves 5 stars. The pancakes are also so good!
full_review: I ate here three times for breakfast while on the island. If I had discovered this place sooner, I would have eaten here every day. They remind me of what IHOP used to be when I was growing up. Ask for maple syrup if you prefer that. I wish I lived closer to this spot because it would be my local favorite ‚ù§Ô∏è.
author: antoinette rodney

review_snippet: We shared the Buffalo chicken spring rolls (surprisingly good), and each had a side Caesar salad and fish and chips.
full_review: We had a memorable dinner here last weekend. The food was excellent; Kay (our server) was professional, thorough, efficient, charmingly funny, and warm; the setting is quaint; and we were happy to support a Black-owned business. We shared the Buffalo chicken spring rolls (surprisingly good), and each had a side Caesar salad and fish and chips. The fish and chips were a very large portion that we couldn‚Äôt finish after the spring rolls and side salads. We took the leftovers home and ate them the next day and it was still delicious.
author: Micah Lubensky

review_snippet: The sushi is hands-down the perfect grab-and-go lunch: fresh, consistent, and ready when we are between shoots and meetings.
full_review:
As a marketing team constantly on the move, Edgartown Meat & Fish is our MVP. The sushi is hands-down the perfect grab-and-go lunch: fresh, consistent, and ready when we are between shoots and meetings. Their wine selection is a lifesaver for client gifting: great labels at a range of price points, plus helpful staff who can point you to exactly the right bottle. And when the day runs long, the prepared foods case makes dinner effortless; think flavorful mains, solid sides, and salads that actually hold up.

Service is quick, the store is organized, and you can check off lunch, gifts, and dinner in one stop. For busy locals and island visitors alike, this place just works. OH AND do not forget the Starbucks inside the market for all your energy needs!
author: Shored Up Digital

review_snippet: Freshly made sushi rolls? YES!
full_review: This is your one stop shop on island!  As someone that lives in Edgartown year round, I appreciate having a market like them open through the winter. Reasons why I love it: they have well stocked shelves of essentials but also fun pantry items - if you want to make any kind of ethnic food, they have sauces and spices to go with your meal. Their meat and seafood cases are always packed with deliciousness. Try their steak tips on the grill, you will fall in love! They also sell side dishes that are great for when you need to put together a quick dinner. Need ice cream? They've got it. Fresh mushrooms and vegetables? They have them! Freshly made sushi rolls? YES! Frozen fried onion rings? Yup, they have them! Plus wine and beer, a Starbucks outpost for everyone the needs their SB hit from time to time, plus they carry so many local products like MV Sea Salt and Val Cakes desserts and Not Your Sugar Mamas coffee. Overall, just an awesome market and the owners are local to the island and the nicest people ever, the staff is so friendly and always helpful!
author: Marnely Murray

review_snippet: We had a mix of dishes from the grilled octopus to some agnolotti that had us ready to lick the plate. Salad and fish along with a sticky toffee desert that I could eat all day.
full_review: I had a wonderful meal here at the the bar with some friends.  The food was delicious, the drinks were well made and the bartender was funny and knowledgeable.  Its definitely one of my favorite places to get a delicious meal on the island and I can't wait to go back! We had a mix of dishes from the grilled octopus to some agnolotti that had us ready to lick the plate.  Salad and fish along with a sticky toffee desert that I could eat all day.
author: Morgan Fykes

review_snippet: Octopus was a bit charred, as was the focaccia but still pretty tasty. Pork belly was amazing.
full_review:
Environment was on point. Service was surprisingly sub par for such a nice spot. Our server was good, but others didn't seem to quite understand restaurant etiquette.
Scallop dish was yummy with the pomegranate seeds.
Octopus was a bit charred, as was the focaccia but still pretty tasty. Pork belly was amazing.
author: Elizabeth Richardson

review_snippet: We share the focaccia, the mussels and mafalde. Each was wonderful.
full_review: Excellent restaurant in Oak Bluff. We started with the Negroni with Balsamic. Delicious. We share the focaccia, the mussels and mafalde. Each was wonderful. For mains, we  had the sea scallops, tautog and pork chops. Each dish was fantastic and enjoyed by all. I highly recommend.
author: Thomas Rollins

review_snippet: The chocolate chip, peanut butter, and the sugar cookies were delicious, too. The service was quick and efficient.
full_review:
We were there off session, in late March, which I'm sure the speed and service efficiency is different from summer months.

The Fall veggie melt on facoccia bread, the turkey bacon wrap, the pastrami sandwich, the vegetarian chili, and he onion soup were delicious.  The chocolate chip, peanut butter, and the sugar cookies were delicious, too.

The service was quick and efficient.  You can place your order ahead of time on the phone and avoid waiting in line.
author: A. M.

review_snippet: Solid place to grab a quick sandwich when you are in the area. Love the pulled pork and turkey BLT.
full_review: Solid place to grab a quick sandwich when you are in the area. Love the pulled pork and turkey BLT. It can get pretty busy in the summer, but I always try to stop by.
author: Laura Laura

review_snippet: Breakfast sandwich on the jalape√±o cheddar biscuit is the way to go. Best oatmeal I‚Äôve ever had, something magical about the maple brown butter.
full_review: Best breakfast up island!!! Breakfast sandwich on the jalape√±o cheddar biscuit is the way to go. Best oatmeal I‚Äôve ever had, something magical about the maple brown butter.
author: DeVita Chiropractic

review_snippet: Their sandwiches are some of the best on island, their Liz Lemon is truly spectacular. Their soups are so so good and tasty delicious!
full_review:
7aFood is truly such a gem on Martha's Vineyard! Locally and family owned, I love supporting this spot! Their sandwiches are some of the best on island, their Liz Lemon is truly spectacular. Their soups are so so good and tasty delicious!

Plus, I always grab a coffee when I am in the area, plus a bag of my favorite Chilmark Coffee beans as well!
author: Marnely Murray

review_snippet: We ordered IN DA Club 4.5/5 and CheeseSteak Bomb 5/5.
full_review: Busy little place. Clean and bright with vibrant artwork. The service is friendly and fast. We ordered IN DA Club 4.5/5 and CheeseSteak Bomb 5/5.
author: Ron Rogers

review_snippet: We ordered IN DA Club 4.5/5 and CheeseSteak Bomb 5/5.
full_review: Busy little place. Clean and bright with vibrant artwork. The service is friendly and fast. We ordered IN DA Club 4.5/5 and CheeseSteak Bomb 5/5.
author: Ron Rogers

review_snippet: The Tiger Fried Chicken Sandwich was absolutely amazing ‚Äî the perfect balance of sweet, spicy, and salty. The portion was generous for the price, and it came out quickly.
full_review: The Tiger Fried Chicken Sandwich was absolutely amazing ‚Äî the perfect balance of sweet, spicy, and salty. The portion was generous for the price, and it came out quickly. I also appreciated that while tipping was an option, they didn‚Äôt automatically tack on a fee when I online ordered, like many places do now. Everything on the menu sounded unique and full of flavor, and I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!
author: K P

review_snippet: Tigerhawk Sandwich Shop in OB is an absolute must-visit for sandwich lovers on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard.
full_review:
Tigerhawk Sandwich Shop in OB is an absolute must-visit for sandwich lovers on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. This spot takes craft sandwiches to the next level, using fresh, high-quality ingredients and bold flavors that make every bite unforgettable. The menu is packed with creative, chef-driven sandwiches, from house-roasted meats to perfectly balanced vegetarian options, all served on awesome bread.

The vibe is laid-back and welcoming - owners Rachel and Jimmy are truly the best, making it the perfect place to grab a quick lunch, takeout for the beach, or a satisfying meal after exploring the island If you‚Äôre looking for the best sandwiches on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard, Tigerhawk is the place to go!
author: Shored Up Digital

review_snippet: I just had The best vegan (grilled tofu & shiitake) sandwich of my life. Definitely worth of visiting!
full_review: I just had The best vegan (grilled tofu & shiitake) sandwich of my life. Definitely worth of visiting! If you are in Oak Bluffs and looking for a quick lunch, Tigerhawk is a must!

review_snippet: Originally came for their poke bowl but they have no tuna on hand, so a little disappointed. Switched to banh mi with pork belly $16+tax.
full_review:
Alright service was 5 stars, friendly and efficient.
Food 4 stars cause I'm more used to the traditional Vietnamese banh mi that uses baguette as they were french influenced.
Originally came for their poke bowl but they have no tuna on hand, so a little disappointed.
Switched to banh mi with pork belly $16+tax.  By now I'm quite used to the higher prices in MV.
4 pieces of square inch or so flavorful pork bellies in a sub sandwich (again baguette would give more crunch) with fresh cucumber slices, pickled jalapenos, cilantro, almost invisible shredded carrots& sauteed onions.  Not bad though sandwich became soggy towards the end with the dressing inside.  Their table top haberneo/pineapple hot sauce was wonderful to add for kicking it up a notch.
author: Ropl

review_snippet: Pictured are the filet-o-fish, hot beef sandwich, waffle fries, and the oatmeal chocolate cookie.
full_review:
Staying in MV for the week, and saw this was across from the house I‚Äôm in. It‚Äôs AMAZING! It was hard choosing between the sandwiches, and I really want to go back for salads and tinned fish.

Got to sit on the couch in the back by the N64, also an added bonus. Plus the staff were super friendly and helped us decide what to order. Pictured are the filet-o-fish, hot beef sandwich, waffle fries, and the oatmeal chocolate cookie.
author: Austin Davis

review_snippet: The sandwiches are saucy and delicious, the desserts are like a hug to your heart, the onion rings are outrageous, and you can sit outdoors and enjoy the weather even on cool fall days!
full_review: I've had probably ten meals at Mo's already since they opened and I just love it so much. The people, the vibes, the service, the food, the love, the creativity! The sandwiches are saucy and delicious, the desserts are like a hug to your heart, the onion rings are outrageous, and you can sit outdoors and enjoy the weather even on cool fall days! Seriously support them - they are incredible community members and the food is LEGIT!
author: Marnely Murray

review_snippet: Our lunch consisted of a cauliflower melt and roast pork sandwich. Outstanding!
full_review: I had read about Mo's, located inside the Portuguese American Club, Oak Bluffs, being a hidden gem. It was our first stop and first dining experience on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside was warm and welcoming. Our lunch consisted of a cauliflower melt and roast pork sandwich. Outstanding! Note... they do offer free water, I didn't notice until after I had bought a water. Make sure you grab a cookie, the size of your head, before you head out! My pick lemon sugar!! Thank you for a delicious lunch Mo's, we are looking forward to seeing you the next time we are on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard!

review_snippet: We had local oysters, Tuna Poke, Halibut Hamachi, beetroot gnocchi, mussels, a super cool carrot dish for 1st and second courses. We then had Char, Sea Bass, Halibut, Scallops.
full_review:
Made reservations the night before while on a sailing charter. Super easy place to get to from the water once you know where it is, a dinghy dock right in front is super helpful.
Dinner was amazing start to finish. Our Waiter was top knotch and the somm was on point.  Great menu that was well executed, and a great wine list that was super fun to explore. We will be back when we come around again.
We had local oysters, Tuna Poke, Halibut Hamachi, beetroot gnocchi, mussels, a super cool carrot dish for 1st and second courses. We then had Char, Sea Bass, Halibut, Scallops.  Each one was spot on. The Scallops were some of the best any of us had every had. The fish dishes were all great with perfectly cooked fish and interesting flavors complementing the fish.

Highly reccommend!
author: Brent Christensen

review_snippet: I tried the beetroot kebab for the first time, and it was absolutely delicious. Both the alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks were also impressive.
full_review: Don‚Äôt be misled by the limited number of reviews‚Äîit‚Äôs only been three weeks since they opened. The food was excellent! I tried the beetroot kebab for the first time, and it was absolutely delicious. Both the alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks were also impressive.
author: Raveendranath Reddy

review_snippet: Our favorites on the menu were the Madrasi chicken, the Goan shrimp curry, and the cheese naan. All were bursting with incredible flavor.
full_review:
We are so excited to finally have year-round Indian cuisine on the Island! We visited Indigo just a few days after they opened (August 2025), and they did not disappoint. Our favorites on the menu were the Madrasi chicken, the Goan shrimp curry, and the cheese naan. All were bursting with incredible flavor.

We also enjoyed the OG Butter Chicken; the sauce was rich and delicious, though we‚Äôd love to see a bit more protein in the portion to balance the sauce-to-protein ratio. Given that we visited within their first week of opening, we imagine they‚Äôre still fine-tuning some of the details, and it certainly didn‚Äôt take away from how tasty the dish was and we‚Äôd happily order it again.

One area that could improve was the speed of service. From placing our order to receiving the food, and when waiting for the check, the pace was slower than ideal - we waited about ~40 minutes for our dishes. It felt like the team is still getting into their rhythm, which is understandable for a brand-new restaurant.

Overall, Indigo is a fantastic addition to the Edgartown dining scene, and we‚Äôre looking forward to many more flavorful meals here!
author: Holly and Kevin

review_snippet:
We got butter chicken, chicken korma, garlic naan, cheese naan and bhel puri chaat
All were delicious and well prepared. I hope this places stays open for years to come!
full_review:
This place is wonderful! Food is amazing and service is great! We got take out and it was delicious.
We got butter chicken, chicken korma, garlic naan, cheese naan and bhel puri chaat
All were delicious and well prepared. I hope this places stays open for years to come! Felt like we were eating offisland somewhere, such a great addition to the island.
author: Ambiemae

Given that we visited within their first week of opening, we imagine they‚Äôre still fine-tuning some of the details, and it certainly didn‚Äôt take away from how tasty the dish was and we‚Äôd happily order it again.

One area that could improve was the speed of service. From placing our order to receiving the food, and when waiting for the check, the pace was slower than ideal - we waited about ~40 minutes for our dishes. It felt like the team is still getting into their rhythm, which is understandable for a brand-new restaurant.

Overall, Indigo is a fantastic addition to the Edgartown dining scene, and we‚Äôre looking forward to many more flavorful meals here!

review_snippet: The oysters were the highlight. Mussels puttanesca was salty.
full_review: The waitress was unclear from the start about needing to order starters and entrees at the same time. Allegedly the chefs preference. In my opinion they want to have you commit for the full meal and deliver sub par food. They did not have any hot beverages. It was absolutely freezing inside with the ac blasting on a cool day. I requested tea and then asked if i could just have hot water with lemon. Kind of ridiculous that a pot of water cant be boiled. The oysters were the highlight. Mussels puttanesca was salty. The salad could have been done better at home.
author: Jasmine Hollins-Gadbois

review_snippet: The filet was amazing and service at the bar was great even though the bartender was busy and it was pretty full.

review_snippet: A couple of the girls got salads, and two of us got the burger and fries, which for me was the best meal of the trip! Great service and spectacular food!
full_review:
My friends and I went on a girls trip to Martha‚Äôs Vineyard the weekend before Memorial Day and this was one of the restaurants a friend recommended. We walked in and right away absolutely loved the atmosphere! Very modern and chic.

Two of us decided to have a cocktail, and we both loved the Ninegroni. A couple of the girls got salads, and two of us got the burger and fries, which for me was the best meal of the trip! Great service and spectacular food!
author: Kelli Costa

review_snippet: We had the lobster tostadas, the pappardelle, and the clam chowder. All three were hits.
full_review:
Food was excellent. We had the lobster tostadas, the pappardelle, and the clam chowder. All three were hits.

They‚Äôre doing some really interesting things with the ingredients‚Äîcreative, but not over the top. Everything was flavorful, and the pappardelle was perfectly al dente. Chowder was rich without being heavy. Lobster tostadas were a standout.

Couldn‚Äôt recommend it more. Solid spot if you're in the area.

review_snippet: The risotto was delicious, the brussel sprouts were fantastic. We had the halibut, the salmon, the pasta, all were really great.
full_review: Excellent, excellent meal, the best we've had in Martha's Vineyard! The risotto was delicious, the brussel sprouts were fantastic. We had the halibut, the salmon, the pasta, all were really great. Really tasty cocktails as well. The service was awesome, the chef is a really cool and the inside has a nice casual vibe. If you come for drinks, check out the nook with the couch seats by the bar!
author: Kareem Alston-Rosales

dish_name: Red Cat Kitchen's Famous Brussel Sprouts
review_snippet: Highly recommend the Brussel Sprouts. Great flavor and enough to share.
full_review:
A local recommended this spot and it did not disappoint. Did not have a reservation but got seats at the bar.   Nice open layout to the restaurant.  Spacious bar with a good selection of drinks and spirits.  Kevin the bartender was very attentive in spite of being busy.

Speciality old fashioned and Manhattan for cocktails.  Both were very good.   We ordered a couple of appetizers rather than meals.

Highly recommend the Brussel Sprouts. Great flavor and enough to share.  The Shrimp and Crab cocktail had a good flavor but not stellar.  We were surprised how small the shrimp were especially at $28.  I would not recommend the shrimp.

Overall a great spot and would eat here again.
author: Chris A

review_snippet: Hopefully, if none of this is enough, a photograph of my filfthy martini with fried chicken + fried tomato combo will help get you in their door ASAP :)
full_review: Without a doubt ~ one of Martha's Vineyard's BEST experiences! Chef (and his glorious brigade of culinary masters) will WOW you with one-of-a-kind creations. Timothy's cocktails are equally crafted to perfection with the most delightful ingredients & a skillful, considerate composition every damn time. Timothy will provide you with the kind of consistency, courteousness, and divine drinks you dream about...he is indeed a hidden treasure of the island! Jacob and the serving staff each bring a special something, too, and I promise you will want to return to see this extraordinary team, the next new & exciting spectacular menu items, and the latest lovely libations ~ all guaranteed to rock your world!!! After years at the Red Cat, I continue to be blown away. If you are on the fence, take a chance...the quality and attention to every detail will keep you coming back for much, much more. Hopefully, if none of this is enough, a photograph of my filfthy martini with fried chicken + fried tomato combo will help get you in their door ASAP :)
author: L T

review_snippet: Must have Brussels, and don‚Äôt sleep on the fried chicken. This br√ªl√©ed Gold Bud Peach was sublime iykyk.
full_review: Outstanding Vibes - A+ staff and hands down the most beautiful food and beverage on Circuit ave. Must have Brussels, and don‚Äôt sleep on the fried chicken. This br√ªl√©ed Gold Bud Peach was sublime iykyk.

review_snippet: We ordered the truffle fries 4.5/5, seared cod tacos 3/5, and fish and chips 4.5/5. The service is good.

The service is good. The atmosphere is modern pub.

review_snippet: We also tried the tuna poke nachos for half of their original price. It was all divine, and the service was impeccable!

author: mary wurthman

review_snippet: The pizza was a cracker (honest to god a 0/10 pizza), the salad was wildly overdressed, and the cheese dip that came with the cauliflower was borderline inedible.
full_review:
The good: The atmosphere is nice, servers were friendly and attentive, and those at the table who ordered seafood were reasonably happy with their meals.

The bad: I hate to leave a poor review, but the non-seafood options were just awful. The pizza was a cracker (honest to god a 0/10 pizza), the salad was wildly overdressed, and the cheese dip that came with the cauliflower was borderline inedible.

I‚Äôm sure the seafood is a safe bet, but if anyone in your party is looking for non-seafood options I can‚Äôt recommend this place.

review_snippet: I had the calamari and it was perfectly cooked and love the aioli sauce.

restaurant_name: Aquila at the Y Cafe - Smoothies & Acai
review_snippet: We also had their cold brew and a latte‚Ä¶ delicious island roasted blend! What a treat!
full_review: An awesome experience!! First of all, this place is so easy to access! Lots of good parking for this inviting little cafe in the public area of the beautiful YMCA building!! We tried the egg sandwich and an acai bowl! So Delicious! Great portions and the staff was so welcoming and attentive! We also had their cold brew and a latte‚Ä¶ delicious island roasted blend! What a treat! Definitely worth checking this place out!! I didn‚Äôt even know the Y allowed folks into the building to their cafe without being a member, but it was easy peasy and so welcoming! Thanks Aquila! We will be back for sure!!
author: Rachel Araujo

review_snippet: The fish and chips, a staple, had an excellent batter, but for nearly $50, was a bit of a eye watering price for two pieces of fried fish on a bed of fries.
full_review:
I like the concept of this place, relaxed, easy, airy, yet with a bent towards sophistication, but there were several misses. First the hits... The mussels were very well done. The sauce was deep, rich and well executed. The big boxy bread was a treat - and the butter a perfect herb infused compliment.

The fish and chips, a staple, had an excellent batter, but for nearly $50, was a bit of a eye watering price for two pieces of fried fish on a bed of fries. The fish that night, in an iridescent green broth, looked divine, but it was thin and rather bland. I heard the duck was well done, but didn't taste it.

In general, if you come here, the service will be great, the prices astronomical, and the food overall solid to very good, the prices knock this down to a B overall.
author: Joseph Raczynski

review_snippet: The pasta dish pictured here was good, but not great; the scallops were good, but again, not a great overall dish (although they were cooked nicely).
full_review:
Had a great experience here. The atmosphere was really casual, but nice; the service was 5 stars; the menu was really inventive. Four stars overall because, even though the food was very unique, it didn‚Äôt deliver as much flavor as I would have liked. The pasta dish pictured here was good, but not great; the scallops were good, but again, not a great overall dish (although they were cooked nicely).

The place is BYOB‚Äî$14 corking fee for a bottle of wine‚Äîwhich I think is very reasonable. Overall, prices are fair.

I‚Äôd go back to try some other things, but for now, I‚Äôm fairly impressed!
author: Robert Jacoby

review_snippet: For my main course I ordered the half chicken. It came with a side salad and was crispy, juicy and delicious.
full_review:
Came on a Monday night for a 5:30pm reservation with 3 girlfriends. We came on the early side because we wanted to watch the sunset on the beach after dinner. The dining room was pretty sparsely populated when we arrived but both the main dining room and the outdoor patio had filled up by the time we left at 6:45.

Since it‚Äôs BYOB, we brought a bottle of wine and a bottle of batched Negronis which our waitress quickly brought out glasses for and served. For dinner we started with the bread, special cheese starter and summer squash. I thought that the squash was really exceptional. For my main course I ordered the half chicken. It came with a side salad and was crispy, juicy and delicious. Two of my girlfriends got the chicken pot pie and said it was one of the best they ever had. The Buffalo Brussels were also on point.

The food here felt like having a great home cooked meal. Looking forward to coming back!
author: Maggie J

review_snippet: Kids shared popcorn chicken and chicken tacos. Both very flavorful.
full_review:
While biking on the island, we picked this place as it's along the bike trail and the price review is not about $50 per person.
I was surprised to see they have sushi counter and menu, but we didn't bother.
The portions were good for the island price. Presentations were nicely done as well.
I had the shrimp scampi. Fresh and plump shrimp. Freshly made fettuccine. It could use a pinch of extra salt to bring out the flavor which I did.
My wife had the pork chop. Very nicely done, tender and juicy. Great flavor.
Kids shared popcorn chicken and chicken tacos. Both very flavorful. The taco had salsa with bacon bits, and that was a nice touch.
author: Ray

review_snippet: My wife had the pork chop. Very nicely done, tender and juicy.

full_review: Came here on a work trip. It was during trivia night so the restaurant was abuzz with people, good music and fun times. Food was very good and the service was quick! I got the Surf and Turf which came with steak tips over mashed potatoes and fried scallops. Delicious!
author: Dumbfat

review_snippet: And the buffalo chicken wrap? Absolutely hit the spot ‚Äî packed with flavor and paired with amazing sides.
full_review:
Nancy‚Äôs was everything. From the second we sat down, we knew we were in for something special. Let‚Äôs start with the fries ‚Äî so crispy, so golden, so delectable they honestly might‚Äôve changed our lives. Easily the star of the table and not just an afterthought side.

The service? Incredible. Attentive and kind without ever hovering ‚Äî they struck the perfect balance between friendly and chill. Even the water was a highlight: icy, crisp, and self-serve (which we loved).

We ordered a lot (the portions were huge) but were pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to box things up to bring home ‚Äî it was all so filling in the best way. The Greek salad was fresh, flavorful, and everything you want from a salad. And the buffalo chicken wrap? Absolutely hit the spot ‚Äî packed with flavor and paired with amazing sides.

The atmosphere was its own kind of magic ‚Äî bustly, coastal, and the perfect blend of casual and classy. The place had such a welcoming, cultural vibe ‚Äî families, friends, reunions, locals, and tourists all mixed in together. The menu had so many diverse options, it felt like everyone could find something they loved.

All in all? Nancy‚Äôs nailed it. The food, the vibe, the service ‚Äî everything. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better meal or a better place to spend our evening.
Five out of five. Would go again in a heartbeat.
author: Jess Freeds

review_snippet: Bolognese pasta is tasty, filling and a treat for the eyes. The ambiance is a reason in and of itself to visit this establishment.
full_review: The best dish is the most ordinary one. Bolognese pasta is tasty, filling and a treat for the eyes. The ambiance is a reason in and of itself to visit this establishment. Vault turned into wine cave, safe door become a communal table and decorations reminiscent of the bank that once stood there give this restaurant a quirky museum touch. The food and cocktails are pricy which leaves you with the expectation for an amazing culinary journey. Cassoulet is delicious but overwhelming in size. Best to be mindful of all the mains being oversized when ordering. It's a nice treat when on the Vineyard.

review_snippet: Tasted great flavor wise and the filling would have been nice on pasta (think meaty bolognese that runs on the dry side, clinging to rigatoni), but honestly I could not cut it thin enough to e...
full_review:
The decor is lovely. The chef hit it out of the park on flavors, Five Stars. Wines by the glass were terrific. The mezze appetizer could not have been better. But that‚Äôs where the good news ended. A restaurant that is always changing its menu runs a risk, the same way that specials at a restaurant are not always as good as the tried and true. It must be difficult for the kitchen at The Ocean Club with all their changing up.
Point in fact, the lasagna bolognese was so dry it may have been the worst thing I have ever ordered. Tasted great flavor wise and the filling would have been nice on pasta (think meaty bolognese that runs on the dry side, clinging to rigatoni), but honestly I could not cut it thin enough to eat and the sparse amount of yummy sauce on the plate that I dipped it in soon ran out. The half duck that (per our server)  took days to prepare had a sauce with a delectable flavor, but the meat was oddly grey and mushy. Maybe cooked too long via sous vide or other method?
I hope they decide to land on a few tried and true menu items, and if they want to get creative, vary the sauce seasonings or sub out an ingredient here and there. Not major shifting like they are doing. Or better yet, leave a core set of selections alone and don‚Äôt mess with perfection.

review_snippet: Caesar salad was pretty standard and the crab cakes were just ok. The sauce and corn was good but the crab cakes were too thin and too fried for my taste.
full_review:
Tried to stop in around noon and were told they were only serving a ‚Äúmezze‚Äù menu and lunch started at 12:30 which was confusingly communicated by the hostess and in an unfriendly way. Not to worry though We grabbed some snacks, coffee, and shopped a bit at all the other Black Dog spots until we were able to be seated at 12:30 with a bunch of other families who were all also waiting to eat. Atmosphere inside is great and you can‚Äôt beat the nostalgia factor. Crab spinach and artichoke dip was incredibly good. The lobster rolls were the best we‚Äôve had yet in the Cape Cod area (although the coleslaw left something to be desired). Caesar salad was pretty standard and the crab cakes were just ok. The sauce and corn was good but the crab cakes were too thin and too fried for my taste. The presentation also could use some work.

Other than the service not being the greatest and the unkind hostess, we had a lovely time with beautiful views and tasty food!

review_snippet: The fish & chips were okay. Our server was amazing and you can‚Äôt beat eating basically on the water.

review_snippet: We ordered the Cobb Salad with Grilled Chicken, the Shrimp Fra Diavolo, and they special-made a Grilled Cheese sandwich. The food was served in small portion size.
full_review:
I brought my family here for lunch for nostalgia as they‚Äôd never been & have heard me speak of the Black Dog for many years. Unfortunately it was during the 1st heat wave of the year. Hoping to catch some relief from the heat when we went inside, we were very disappointed to find they had all the windows open and no air conditioning on. I was literally sweating from head to toe. No breeze today. Not even a fan for some relief for those sitting by the opened windows.
The waitress was very polite and professional. Her speed was appreciated. We ordered the Cobb Salad with Grilled Chicken, the Shrimp Fra Diavolo, and they special-made a Grilled Cheese sandwich. The food was served in small portion size. The shrimp pasta was a bit spicy for my hubby, but he did eat the whole thing. I would have liked more greens on my plate but it was delicious. My daughter thought the Grilled cheese and sides were delicious. We found we were still hungry only a couple hours afterwards. I believe they‚Äôre overpriced for what we received; mainly paying for the brand rather than the food. We probably won‚Äôt be returning and really don‚Äôt recommend if you‚Äôre really hungry.

review_snippet: The honey dipped tasted like a regular glazed donut - nothing unique. The cinnamon was good, and so was the buttermilk.
full_review:
Walked here for a late night donut craving. Luckily the line was short but they were out several of the most popular flavors, although they still had apple fritters.

This spot is literally operated out of the back door of the business, inside of the parking lot. It's nothing fancy but it's definitely a cool vibe and a novel idea. Flavors we tried: Honey dipped, cinnamon, buttermilk and the infamous apple fritter. The honey dipped tasted like a regular glazed donut - nothing unique. The cinnamon was good, and so was the buttermilk. The apple fritter received good reviews. I plan to return to try other flavors. Overall everything was good and I recommend this place.

The Cellar feels like a hidden gem under one of the island‚Äôs classic spot - laid-back but still polished, and a super fun place to post up for dinner or drinks.

review_snippet: We had a beer, the basket of fries, and the coconut shrimp‚Ä¶ which my girlfriend said was the best she‚Äôs ever had. She swore she can never eat coconut shrimp again unless it‚Äôs from Coop de Ville.
full_review:
One of our favorite stops on Martha‚Äôs Vineyard! We weren‚Äôt planning on sitting down, but after the owner greeted us and told us about their BBQ Wednesdays, we decided to grab a seat‚Äîand we‚Äôre so glad we did. We had a beer, the basket of fries, and the coconut shrimp‚Ä¶ which my girlfriend said was the best she‚Äôs ever had. She swore she can never eat coconut shrimp again unless it‚Äôs from Coop de Ville.

Our server, who was originally from Jamaica, was incredibly kind and welcoming, and the whole vibe was just unmatched‚Äîgreat reggae music, amazing views of the Oak Bluffs harbor, and a laid-back energy that made us want to stay for hours.

The owner mentioned he‚Äôs been running the place for 30+ years, and you can feel the love and history in every corner. We‚Äôll be back every year we visit the island. Absolutely recommend stopping by if you‚Äôre anywhere near Oak Bluffs. üå¥üç§üçª

review_snippet: And then, the beef carpaccio ‚Äî paper-thin, melt-in-your-mouth tender, and bursting with flavor in every bite. Service was flawless from start to finish.
full_review:
A Culinary Gem That Outshines Even the View ‚Äì Bettini at Harbor View Hotel
Bettini at the Harbor View Hotel is one of those rare places where the food, service, and setting harmonize so perfectly that you almost forget which one impressed you first. Yes, the view of Edgartown Harbor is breathtaking ‚Äî the kind that glows in the golden light of Martha‚Äôs Vineyard ‚Äî but here, it‚Äôs the food that truly steals the show.

Under the remarkable leadership of Executive Chef Juan Martinez and Sous Chef Momo Camara, every plate is crafted with soul and precision. The scallop crudo was a masterpiece of restraint ‚Äî impossibly fresh, delicate, kissed with just the right acidity to let the sea speak for itself. The lobster bucatini came next, beautifully balanced with a subtle kick that added warmth without overwhelming the sweet richness of the lobster. And then, the beef carpaccio ‚Äî paper-thin, melt-in-your-mouth tender, and bursting with flavor in every bite.

Service was flawless from start to finish. Our bartender Taylor made the most beautiful hot cocoa for my daughter ‚Äî just the right temperature, velvety, and not too hot ‚Äî proof of the team‚Äôs thoughtful attention to detail. Andrei, our server, was both attentive and genuinely funny, effortlessly remembering each of my kids‚Äô names after our very first dinner. That kind of personal touch transforms a meal into a memory.

Bettini isn‚Äôt just a hotel restaurant ‚Äî it‚Äôs a culinary destination in its own right. Whether you come for the harbor views, the impeccable service, or the artistry on your plate, you‚Äôll leave knowing you‚Äôve just experienced something special.
author: Melissa Lee

review_snippet: The lobster bucatini came next, beautifully balanced with a subtle kick that added warmth without overwhelming the sweet richness of the lobster.
full_review:
A Culinary Gem That Outshines Even the View ‚Äì Bettini at Harbor View Hotel
Bettini at the Harbor View Hotel is one of those rare places where the food, service, and setting harmonize so perfectly that you almost forget which one impressed you first. Yes, the view of Edgartown Harbor is breathtaking ‚Äî the kind that glows in the golden light of Martha‚Äôs Vineyard ‚Äî but here, it‚Äôs the food that truly steals the show.

Under the remarkable leadership of Executive Chef Juan Martinez and Sous Chef Momo Camara, every plate is crafted with soul and precision. The scallop crudo was a masterpiece of restraint ‚Äî impossibly fresh, delicate, kissed with just the right acidity to let the sea speak for itself. The lobster bucatini came next, beautifully balanced with a subtle kick that added warmth without overwhelming the sweet richness of the lobster. And then, the beef carpaccio ‚Äî paper-thin, melt-in-your-mouth tender, and bursting with flavor in every bite.

Service was flawless from start to finish. Our bartender Taylor made the most beautiful hot cocoa for my daughter ‚Äî just the right temperature, velvety, and not too hot ‚Äî proof of the team‚Äôs thoughtful attention to detail. Andrei, our server, was both attentive and genuinely funny, effortlessly remembering each of my kids‚Äô names after our very first dinner. That kind of personal touch transforms a meal into a memory.

Bettini isn‚Äôt just a hotel restaurant ‚Äî it‚Äôs a culinary destination in its own right. Whether you come for the harbor views, the impeccable service, or the artistry on your plate, you‚Äôll leave knowing you‚Äôve just experienced something special.
author: Melissa Lee

full_review: The food and ambiance are wonderful. Try the lobster bucatini, you won't be disappointed. Request Alex as your server, he is so attentive and thoughtful. He made my birthday so special!

review_snippet: The chicken dish was spectacular, beautifully cooked and full of flavor. We ended on a sweet note with the chocolate torte, a lovely finish to an unforgettable meal.
full_review:
We had an incredible experience at Bettini, made even more memorable by the outstanding service from bartenders Hunter and Taylor. We were celebrating my friend's new job in LA, so we wanted somewhere we could feel extra special celebrating.

Sitting at the bar was the perfect choice ‚Äî the atmosphere was welcoming, the conversation flowed easily, and the bartenders professionalism truly stood out. Hunter crafted what was hands down the best espresso martini we‚Äôve ever had, setting the tone for a fantastic evening. Taylor made us one of the signature cocktails of Bettini as well and truly - another five star drink to start the night. The ambiance at Bettini strikes a perfect balance between elegant and inviting, making it an ideal spot for a relaxed yet elevated night out.

The food was equally impressive. We started with the beef skewers, which were incredibly tender, and the shrimp empanadas, which were perfectly crisp and flavorful. The gnocchi with wild mushrooms and truffle was a standout ‚Äî rich, decadent, and absolutely delicious. The chicken dish was spectacular, beautifully cooked and full of flavor. We ended on a sweet note with the chocolate torte, a lovely finish to an unforgettable meal. If you're visiting Edgartown, a meal at Bettini is a must and we highly recommend grabbing a seat at the bar ‚Äî between the amazing service, exquisite food, and lively ambiance, it‚Äôs an experience you won‚Äôt want to miss. Taylor and Hunter are true professionals and we look forward to coming in again and telling all our friends about our experience!
author: Shored Up Digital

review_snippet: Our kids enjoyed playing a few games while we relaxed, and we also tried the cod sandwich‚Äîperfectly cooked, with a flavorful aioli that really stood out. The fries were fresh, hot, and tasty.
full_review:
Amazing Oysters & Laid-Back Island Vibes

Our first attempt to visit Nomans was on a Friday night‚Äîunknowingly right when it seemed like everyone on the island had the same idea! We decided to try again on Saturday afternoon, and I‚Äôm so glad we did. The vibes were still popping, but without the long wait.

Molly, the bartender, was fantastic‚Äîfriendly, welcoming, and pouring some truly delicious drinks. We enjoyed a couple of Mai Tais and a strong Old Fashioned before diving into the main event: the oysters. And let me tell you‚Ä¶ these were AH-mazing‚Äîso fresh, so tasty, just downright guuud! We started with a half dozen, but they were so good we had to order another half dozen. I can honestly say these are probably the best oysters I‚Äôve had to date.

Our kids enjoyed playing a few games while we relaxed, and we also tried the cod sandwich‚Äîperfectly cooked, with a flavorful aioli that really stood out. The fries were fresh, hot, and tasty. The music (not live) added to the already chill, island vibe, making it even easier to kick back and enjoy the afternoon.

I‚Äôm so glad our plans shifted to Saturday instead of Friday‚Äîit made for the perfect, laid-back island experience. We‚Äôll definitely be back!
author: Tisha Burgess

review_snippet: It streamlines food and drink orders by offering counter service. This allows them to service many customers in a short period of time.
full_review:
Noman‚Äôs has become an annual outing during our vacation.  It streamlines food and drink orders by offering counter service.  This allows them to service many customers in a short period of time.

It‚Äôs amazing to see retirees enjoying a meal together while kids run circles around the tables.  The atmosphere is laid back, which makes it suitable and welcoming to all.  They have great music, tasty food, a raw bar, and a wide selection of drinks.  Seating is first-come, first-served, so you may need to stake out your location.  Parking can also be difficult, and they offer an off-site shuttle service.

Food in the photo includes short rib tacos (left), kale salad (right), and potato salad (back).

Noman‚Äôs has become an annual outing during our vacation.  It streamlines food and drink orders by offering counter service.  This allows them to service many customers in a short period of time.

It‚Äôs amazing to see retirees enjoying a meal together while kids run circles around the tables.  The atmosphere is laid back, which makes it suitable and welcoming to all.  They have great music, tasty food, a raw bar, and a wide selection of drinks.  Seating is first-come, first-served, so you may need to stake out your location.  Parking can also be difficult, and they offer an off-site shuttle service.

Food in the photo includes short rib tacos (left), kale salad (right), and potato salad (back).
author: Jonathan Stallsmith

review_snippet: For dessert, we ordered the honey pie, which was light and not overally sweet, and was paired with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It's definitely worth checking out.
full_review: Delicious food with fresh ingredients. We ordered the spicy cucumber salad, which beat expectations, the olive spread, and halibut. The halibut had a beautiful salty crust and was cooked perfectly.   For dessert, we ordered the honey pie, which was light and not overally sweet, and was paired with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It's definitely worth checking out.
author: N F

review_snippet: We also enjoyed the sweet and spicy cucumbers, marinated olives, halibut tartare, and the honey pie. I'm a dessert connoisseur, and this honey pie did not disappoint me!
full_review: I would give The Covington more than 5 stars if I could! The decor is simple and elegant, but the food is out of this world. We shared the fish special (meant for 2-3 people) and it was perfect for two of us with big appetites. We also enjoyed the sweet and spicy cucumbers, marinated olives, halibut tartare, and the honey pie. I'm a dessert connoisseur, and this honey pie did not disappoint me!
author: antoinette rodney

review_snippet: We also enjoyed the sweet and spicy cucumbers, marinated olives, halibut tartare, and the honey pie. I'm a dessert connoisseur, and this honey pie did not disappoint me!

We also enjoyed the sweet and spicy cucumbers, marinated olives, halibut tartare, and the honey pie. I'm a dessert connoisseur, and this honey pie did not disappoint me!
author: antoinette rodney

review_snippet: We shared the sweet potato rolls, squash and beans, smoked beets, garden salad, basil and walnut pesto ricotta gnocchi, and mushroom ragu.
full_review: I now have a new favorite restaurant! Covington has exceptional staff, amazing flavors and combinations, top notch freshness, and is an all-around fantastic place. We actually went back for dinner here during our four night stay because it was that good, and we wanted to try the other dishes. We shared the sweet potato rolls, squash and beans, smoked beets, garden salad, basil and walnut pesto ricotta gnocchi, and mushroom ragu. All were amazingly delicious and presented quickly and beautifully. Both evenings we dined outside at a lovely little side table. This place is hard to beat! I would give it six stars if I could.
author: Tara Clapper

review_snippet: I‚Äôm not one to order bolognese but it was delicious as well as the seafood fettuccine. I‚Äôll be returning every year.
full_review: 10/10 recommend grabbing dinner here if you can. I‚Äôm not one to order bolognese but it was delicious as well as the seafood fettuccine. I‚Äôll be returning every year.
author: Kathieya Bell

review_snippet: The fish tacos were terrible. Literally a frozen fish stick, which must be pretty embarrassing for this place because they charged $30 for that meal and claim to be a fish place.
full_review: The fish tacos were terrible. Literally a frozen fish stick, which must be pretty embarrassing for this place because they charged $30 for that meal and claim to be a fish place. The fish stick in my taco makes an audible sound when knocked against the table. It was surprising because the fish and chips were decent and freshly made. The lobster Mac and cheese was good.
author: Benjamin Daniels

review_snippet: We were really hungry and thus ordered Shrimp Quesadillas, Buffalo Chicken Wings and 5$  burgers. Shrimp Quesadillas were really great and exactly what we needed to have at that moment.
full_review: We were relieved to find this place open as most of the restaurants in Oak Bluffs of Martha's Vineyard were closed during the winters. We were really hungry and thus ordered Shrimp Quesadillas, Buffalo Chicken Wings and 5$  burgers. Shrimp Quesadillas were really great and exactly what we needed to have at that moment. The hospitality was nice and the place had some cool music running too.
author: Soumya Saha

review_snippet: We ordered raw oysters 3.5/5 (small), shrimp cocktail 4/5, Caesar salad 4/5, warm buttered lobster roll 4/5, PAN ROASTED MISO SALMON 5/5, and Boston cream pie 3/5 (dry).
full_review:
I‚Äôm not sure why the reviews are poor. The service is good. The large deck offers nice views. The food is pretty solid for a place that it doesn‚Äôt have to be. We ordered raw oysters 3.5/5 (small), shrimp cocktail 4/5, Caesar salad 4/5, warm buttered lobster roll 4/5, PAN ROASTED MISO SALMON 5/5, and Boston cream pie 3/5 (dry).

Good beer, wine, and cocktail options.
author: Ron Rogers

review_snippet: Enjoyed the lobster roll and the fisherman's platter. Loved it so much we went twice in the same week!
full_review: Great food, great service and great location. Enjoyed the lobster roll and the fisherman's platter. Loved it so much we went twice in the same week!
author: John Gilliland

review_snippet: I ordered  lobster roll in butter accompanied with fries. The lobster was sweet and tender as it should be.
full_review: This restaurant is a great spot to watch the boats and ferry to Chappy.  We started out with a berry lemonade drink which was very refreshing and delicious. We had the lobster dip app which came with warm pita chips. The dip itself was loaded with fresh lobster and was mouth watering spectacular.  I ordered  lobster roll in butter accompanied with fries.  The lobster was sweet and tender as it should be.  It was heavenly good.  Our waitress was smiling, friendly and just an all around great waitress.  She checked back with us often and we appreciated her efforts.
author: Steven Ballot

review_snippet: The Clam Chowder had a good flavor and was very creamy. The fried shrimp platter was okay, but seemed a bit overpriced for the amount of shrimp.
full_review: Arrived at 6:00 pm on a cloudy Wednesday evening and were seated upstairs in the open air seating. Wonderful views over the harbor and you can watch the Chappy ferry on its constant back and forth journey. Service was good. The lobster roll was served with fries and had lots of chunk lobster ‚Äì seemed to be a good value.  The Clam Chowder had a good flavor and was very creamy.  The fried shrimp platter was okay, but seemed a bit overpriced for the amount of shrimp. The winner was the lobster dip appetizer, served with lots of crispy pita bread. We also loved the Ocean Berry Booze cocktail. Would go back for the dip, cocktail and the great views. Outside seating was very full when we left around 7:30 pm.
author: Scott Scheleur

review_snippet: We ordered avocado toast 5/5 and corned beef hash with eggs 5/5. They house make the corned beef.
full_review: This was our favorite place to eat in Edgartown. Open air cafe with flowers all around. The staff is friendly and helpful. The food is very good. We ordered avocado toast 5/5 and corned beef hash with eggs 5/5. They house make the corned beef. Highly recommend. We ate here twice in three days.
author: Ron Rogers

review_snippet: Whether you're craving a gourmet sandwich from their deli, browsing through their impressive selection of wines and beers, or indulging in freshly baked goods, this market has it all.
full_review:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Tony's Market in Oak Bluffs is an absolute treasure trove of delights! From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a tantalizing array of options that you never knew you needed until now. Whether you're craving a gourmet sandwich from their deli, browsing through their impressive selection of wines and beers, or indulging in freshly baked goods, this market has it all.

One of the highlights is their dedication to local produce, offering the freshest fruits and vegetables that capture the essence of Martha's Vineyard. And let's not forget their well-stocked shelves of newspapers and magazines, perfect for grabbing a read while enjoying a delicious snack.

Tony's Market isn't just a grocery store‚Äîit's an experience. The friendly staff, cozy atmosphere, and diverse offerings make it a must-visit destination for both locals and tourists alike. Trust me, you'll leave with more than just groceries‚Äîyou'll leave with a newfound appreciation for the finer things in life.
author: Grace Hagerty

review_snippet: The ice cream is painstakingly hand crafted using the finest ingredients available. Each bite is a taste bud orgasm.
full_review: Mad Martha‚Äôs is da bomb. Love this place. The ice cream is painstakingly hand crafted using the finest ingredients available. Each bite is a taste bud orgasm. The place is spotless clean. It even smells good. The team members are extremely friendly and courteous. The attention to detail includes insulated to go bags. It‚Äôs everything you need and want in homemade ice cream. Treat yourself and your family today. Ask for Johanna. She has the biggest smile. God Bless Blue & Gold! God Bless America! review_snippet: Ice cream is flavorful and creamy.
full_review: I love Mad Martha‚Äôs! The workers are always so friendly and nice. Ice cream is flavorful and creamy. This is a must stop when in Edgartown

full_review: I loved this place! The ice cream is so creamy and tasteful. I had the sinful chocolate flavor and I 100% recommend it! There is some seating inside, we were able to sit because it wasn‚Äôt busy. Not sure how busy it gets though!

review_snippet: The sandwich I ordered was excellent, full of flavor, and the coffee was just as good. It‚Äôs a great place to stop with the whole family, with both indoor and outdoor seating options.
full_review: Rosewater is a fantastic spot for a casual meal in Edgartown. The place was busy when I visited, but the service was efficient and quick ‚Äî a sign of how popular it is. As a first-time customer traveling for work, I wasn‚Äôt disappointed. The sandwich I ordered was excellent, full of flavor, and the coffee was just as good. It‚Äôs a great place to stop with the whole family, with both indoor and outdoor seating options. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in town and looking for a tasty bite with friendly, fast service.
author: Time Capture Production llc

review_snippet: We will be back tomorrow for the gluten free treats!!Hubby also had a medium roast coffee he said it was good but loves cream in his coffee but he has yet to find cream on the island.
full_review:
Hubby and I stopped by for breakfast. They had a small menu for breakfast and lunch but yummy choices! They had some gluten free bakery treats which was great for hubby!! I ordered bacon egg and cheese on a homemade English muffin. FYI they only have cheddar or goat cheese for cheese options. It was hot fresh and yummy.
Hubby had the loaded hash browns and added scrambled eggs but no sour cream. When I opened the container to take a picture it was not what I was expecting but hubby said it was good. It must have been because he did not share!! We will be back tomorrow for the gluten free treats!!Hubby also had a medium roast coffee he said it was good but loves cream in his coffee but he has yet to find cream on the island.
author: Kathleen McDonough

review_snippet: I had to do EVERYTHING myself but they want you to Tip before even sipping a coffee or tasting the food. I find that bizarre!
full_review:
This is a place where people meet up with babies in strollers. Very kind friendly.

I had to do EVERYTHING myself but they want you to Tip before even sipping a coffee or tasting the food. I find that bizarre!

The burrito was good, but its wrapped as if you are going to take it off of the premises.

Toilets were clean and the patio was well maintained.
author: Kevin Giles

review_snippet: As for the drinks, the Matcha Latte I did not care for, but Chai Latte and Hot Chocolate were good.
full_review: Ate here everyday for almost a week when I visited the island.  My favorite was the Egg Sandwich - the homemade biscuit was so, so good!  I also had the Spicy Peanut Bowl and Kimchi Fried Rice which were just okay.  The Caesar Salad Wrap needs a little more Caesar dressing for flavor and it needs more lettuce so you're not biting mostly on tortilla wrap.  Chicken Sandwich was good. As for the drinks, the Matcha Latte I did not care for, but Chai Latte and Hot Chocolate were good.
author: Alexis C

review_snippet: Waterside Market on Martha's Vineyard is a must do for me for their amazing Lobster Eggs Benedict.
full_review:
Waterside Market on Martha's Vineyard is a must do for me for their amazing Lobster Eggs Benedict. Tangy Hollandaise sauce what lots of fresh Lobster, and yes they will use claw and knuckle meat so you get the sweetest bites. Add to that a beautiful wraparound porch and it's a great way to start your morning.
Waterside Market Visit Martha's Vineyard
author: Vincent Errichetti (Taste of Massachusetts)

review_snippet: The French Quarter, Lucy Vincent, and old bay fries were very good too. Great drink selection and good coffee as well.
full_review: The CAB was the star of the show. Such great flavor on it! The French Quarter, Lucy Vincent, and old bay fries were very good too. Great drink selection and good coffee as well. They had a lot of products on tables and shelves both from the island local and other regional retailers.
author: Sean Morgan

review_snippet: The French Quarter, Lucy Vincent, and old bay fries were very good too. Great drink selection and good coffee as well.
full_review: The CAB was the star of the show. Such great flavor on it! The French Quarter, Lucy Vincent, and old bay fries were very good too. Great drink selection and good coffee as well. They had a lot of products on tables and shelves both from the island local and other regional retailers.
author: Sean Morgan

review_snippet: Well stocked store with fresh menu, including breakfast all day, and cafe. We ordered a Red White and Green as well as a CAB, both prepared quickly and delicious!
full_review: Well stocked store with fresh menu, including breakfast all day, and cafe. We ordered a Red White and Green as well as a CAB, both prepared quickly and delicious! We also devoured a bag of the park truffle chips made in house. Ample seating inside, and they had a restroom for customers. Highly recommend!
author: Michael Leake

review_snippet: I had the pleasure of grabbing breakfast takeout and lattes from Waterside Market in Vineyard Haven, and it was an absolute delight!
full_review: I had the pleasure of grabbing breakfast takeout and lattes from Waterside Market in Vineyard Haven, and it was an absolute delight! The breakfast options were fresh, flavorful, and perfectly portioned. The bagels were toasted just right, and the pastries were a wonderful treat. The lattes were expertly made‚Äîsmooth, rich, and just the right balance of coffee and milk. The staff was friendly and efficient, making the whole experience seamless. If you're in the area, Waterside Market is a must-visit for a delicious, quick breakfast with amazing coffee. Highly recommend!
author: Grace Hagerty

review_snippet: The Cobb salad was a great portion and very flavorful, and the red ale was cold, refreshing, and paired perfectly with the meal. Overall, amazing food and great service,definitely recommend!
full_review: This place was absolutely worth the wait! It was packed when we arrived, so be ready to wait a bit, but trust me, it‚Äôs worth it. The Reuben was one of the best we‚Äôve ever had, and the homemade chips were perfectly crisp and delicious. The California roll was fresh and tasty, and the spider roll was good too. The shrimp dumplings weren‚Äôt our favorite and tasted a bit frozen, but everything else more than made up for it. The Cobb salad was a great portion and very flavorful, and the red ale was cold, refreshing, and paired perfectly with the meal. Overall, amazing food and great service,definitely recommend!
author: Jon Rogers

review_snippet: Jumbo Tavern Lobster roll and Texas Burger. This was my first ever lobster roll and I loved it.
full_review:
Jumbo Tavern Lobster roll and Texas Burger.  This was my first ever lobster roll and I loved it.  It was such a large portion I thought I would never finish it, I was wrong, I ate ever last bite and the fries along with it!  The hubby enjoyed his burger and fries also.  We sat at the bar with a view of the water.  Service was excellent.  The bartender recommended which lobster roll to get and I am so happy with the choice.  Drinks: Tito‚Äôs & lemonade and the hubby got a local IPA.üç∫
Clean bathrooms.

review_snippet: Before our meals arrived, we shared calamari and fried oysters as appetizers, and both were absolutely delicious‚Äîcrispy, well-seasoned, and the perfect way to start the meal.
full_review:
Perfect Kickoff to Our Martha‚Äôs Vineyard Stay

Lookout Tavern was the very first restaurant we visited when we arrived on the island, and it set the tone for a fantastic trip. Our party of six enjoyed a total of four (maybe five!) warm lobster rolls, one shrimp platter, four rum punches, and one or two lemonades‚Äîand everything was fresh, flavorful, and delicious. The lobster rolls were especially memorable‚Äîtender lobster meat, perfectly seasoned, and served warm.

Before our meals arrived, we shared calamari and fried oysters as appetizers, and both were absolutely delicious‚Äîcrispy, well-seasoned, and the perfect way to start the meal.

When we arrived, we were told the wait might be around 30 minutes, but in reality, it was only about 10. That gave us just enough time to take a quick walk across the pier and enjoy the view before being seated. We were placed at a comfortable picnic table with a great view of the lively scene around us‚Äîpeople enjoying good food, great weather, and relaxed island vibes.

The service was friendly, the food came out quickly, and the overall atmosphere made for the perfect kickoff to our stay on the Vineyard. We will absolutely be back on our next visit‚Äîespecially for those lobster rolls!
author: Tisha Burgess

full_review: The food is very good. This restaurant is take out only. I had the jerked chicken wrap which was huge. Tawnee had the chicken strips with fries. We were there midweek after Labor Day. dish_name: Pan-Seared, Spice-Crusted Fresh La Belle Farm Duck Foie Gras
review_snippet: I began my meal with the pan-seared, spice-crusted fresh La Belle Farm duck foie gras, which was honestly the best foie gras I've ever tasted.
full_review:
L‚Äô√©toile Restaurant provides an exceptional upscale dining experience within a beautiful setting, both indoors and outdoors. Located inside the hotel, the ambiance is perfect for an intimate dinner or a family outing. The hostess and staff were friendly and professional, making the evening even more enjoyable.

I began my meal with the pan-seared, spice-crusted fresh La Belle Farm duck foie gras, which was honestly the best foie gras I've ever tasted. The charred factor added a unique twist, enhancing the flavor without overpowering the delicate texture, allowing the foie gras to still melt in your mouth.

For the entr√©e, I chose the √©tuv√©e of 1 1/2-pound Menemsha lobster, a dish bursting with flavor. The sauce, highlighted by roasted garlic, truly made the lobster shine. To finish, I enjoyed an espresso martini, one of the best I've had in a long time. This version used chocolate liquor, offering a delightful twist on the classic drink.

While I wasn't a fan of the "Matcha My Freak" and "Whistle While You Work" cocktails, I suspect it was more due to my personal taste preferences. Despite this, I am eager to return and try other drinks on the menu.

Overall, L‚Äô√©toile Restaurant is a fantastic location for an elegant dining experience. I highly recommend it for those seeking a sophisticated meal in a picturesque setting.
author: Michael P

review_snippet: The Menemsha Lobster was prepared perfectly and so was the Rack of  Lamb Chops. I would go back in a heartbeat but it took months to get a reservation.
full_review: My Wife and I had an amazing dining experience at L'Etoile from the moment we arrived to good bye!  We ate out in the front yard which made all the difference.   The lawn dining area / open tent is close enough to the street to see people go by but not too close for comfort.  The garden area as you walk in was in peak bloom.  It was a cool summer night with soft blues playing from a bar close by.   We had Oysters Two-Styles.  I Never had an oyster with cream in the shell, very good and std vinegar type. Excellent.  The Menemsha Lobster was prepared perfectly and so was the Rack of  Lamb Chops.   I would go back in a heartbeat but it took months to get a reservation.  Cost for dinner and drinks for two was $213 + tip.   A real night to remember.
author: Dave Gordon

review_snippet:
Food:
- Braised short ribs ($22) were delicious but it was the maple-smoked cheddar polenta that temped us to lick the plate clean
- Lamb chop ($52) was delicious, no gamey-ness at all.
full_review:
My husband and I had dinner at l'etoile for our wedding anniversary and we're impressed by the restaurant's ambience, food, and level of service.

Food:
- Braised short ribs ($22) were delicious but it was the maple-smoked cheddar polenta that temped us to lick the plate clean
- Lamb chop ($52) was delicious, no gamey-ness at all. The accompanying spinach and roast tomato grape leaf tartlet seemed random but was very tasty!
- Lobster ($68) was delicious, as was the pasta. That said, this entree was spendy.

Ambience:
Like many businesses in Edgartown, this restaurant is in a house, with seating on the front lawn on Adirondack chairs, inside in tastefully renovated rooms with mood lighting, or outside under a semi-permanent tent that still has tables dressed with white tablecloths and decorated as tastefully as the restaurant's indoor dining tables.

Service:
The staff were very friendly, attentive, well-trained, quick with the water refills, and not too stuffy or pompous. We felt very welcome!

Parking:
Street parking only, which can be hard to come by in the area, even during the off season.
author: Jane Ma Nolan
